title: 10 combine standouts that could make sense for Patriots to select in April’s NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Texas A&M WR KC Concepcion and Indiana WR Omar Cooper impress as potential Patriots draft picks.
EDGE rushers like Romello Height and Malachi Lawrence show strong combine performances, might interest Patriots.
Vanderbilt TE Eli Stowers shines at combine; a possible target in NFL Draft's early rounds for Patriots.

title: Insider: Patriots probably won’t make a ‘Micah Parsons-type’ trade this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots unlikely to make major offseason trades involving significant draft capital, according to ESPN's Mike Reiss.
Patriots reportedly have interest in Eagles' A.J. Brown and Raiders' Maxx Crosby but are hesitant due to high asking prices.
New England emphasizes building through the draft, possessing 11 picks for the 2026 NFL Draft, mostly in later rounds.

title: Largest energy storage facility statewide gets approved for construction in Everett
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The largest battery energy storage system in Massachusetts will be constructed on the former ExxonMobil site in Everett.
Jupiter Power received zoning exemptions and state approval for a 16.5-acre facility with 816 lithium-ion battery enclosures.
The project connects new substations to Eversource's Mystic Substation, aiding the state's clean energy transition and renewable energy integration.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Connor Storrie hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Connor Storrie hosted the Feb. 28 episode of 'SNL,' featuring Mumford & Sons as the musical guest.
Storrie's 'Heated Rivalry' co-star Hudson Williams appeared in a sketch and introduced the musical act on the show.
Members of the US Olympic hockey teams, including Megan Keller and Hilary Knight, appeared during Storrie's opening monologue.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s loss against the Red Bulls
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution lost 1-0 to the New York Red Bulls at Sports Illustrated Stadium, marking their second defeat of the season.
The Revolution's defense, bolstered by Brayan Ceballos and Mamadou Fofana, endured Red Bulls' 73% first-half possession.
Revolution struggled offensively against New York's press, with Carles Gil completing 71% of his passes under pressure.

title: Triston Casas reportedly unlikely to be ready by Opening Day, while Kutter Crawford, Patrick Sandoval take step forward in rehab
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Triston Casas is unlikely to be ready for MLB action by Opening Day, following a torn patellar tendon last May.
Red Sox pitchers Kutter Crawford and Patrick Sandoval recently advanced in rehab, throwing live batting practice at Fenway South.
Crawford and Sandoval aim to be ready for Opening Day but acknowledge uncertainty due to previous injuries.

title: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to enforce illegal passing laws
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Chicopee has installed security cameras on school bus stop arms to enforce laws against illegal passing of stopped school buses.
The cameras, provided by BusPatrol, activate when a bus's stop sign arm extends, capturing violations for later citation.
Chicopee's program follows a state law allowing such measures, incurring no cost to the city, school district, or taxpayers.

title: Review and setlist: Chris Stapleton brings the blues to Mohegan Sun Arena
author: Chris Stevens
bullets: Chris Stapleton played to a sold-out crowd at Mohegan Sun Arena, performing a mix of blues and ballads.
The concert featured an intimate setup with Stapleton, an eight-piece band, and no opening act.
Stapleton's set included hits like 'Tennessee Whiskey' and 'Joy of My Life,' ending with a guitar solo encore.

title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Stefon Diggs could be cut to save $16.8 million in cap space, despite being a key player for the Patriots.
Wide receivers DeMario Douglas, Mack Hollins, and Kayshon Boutte face potential release, potentially saving $3-$4 million each.
Linebacker Christian Elliss and center Garrett Bradbury may be cut, saving New England several million in cap space.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not play in Sunday's Celtics-76ers game as he continues to recover from an Achilles injury.
Philadelphia's Joel Embiid will miss Sunday's game against the Celtics due to an oblique strain, expected out for three games.
The Celtics have won eight of their last ten games and are second in the Eastern Conference standings.
